kwoot joined #xwiki at 09:32  
kwoot - (09:35): question: I currently have trouble with xwiki to display wide tables because the screen seems fixed width. I use the the defaultskin but also have some panels on the right side. If I move those to the left would I then have a not fixed width screen, so the screen would scale horizontally with large tables?  
kwoot - (09:46): hello?  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 09:48  
vmassol1 joined #xwiki at 09:48  
vmassol1 - (09:51): good morning  
vmassol1 - (09:51): starting the release!  
vmassol left at 09:52 (Ping timeout: 252 seconds  
kwoot - (09:52): question: I currently have trouble with xwiki to display wide tables because the screen seems fixed width. I use the the defaultskin but also have some panels on the right side. If I move those to the left would I then have a not fixed width screen, so the screen would scale horizontally with large tables?  
vmassol1 - (09:55): mflorea: what's your status re 2.6 final release?  
vmassol1 - (09:55): (I see you've just changed something in the colibri skin at the last moment… :))  
mflorea - (09:55): it was a fix  
vmassol1 - (09:56): it was a revert from the log  
mflorea - (09:56): I don't have other commits for 2.6  
vmassol1 - (09:56): ok  
vmassol1 - (09:56): and this is stable?  
vmassol1 - (09:56): (I mean the changes you've made)  
vmassol1 - (09:56): stable as in "no risky"  
mflorea - (09:57): yes, it affects only IE and I tested on IE6/7/8  
vmassol1 - (09:57): I'm asking since I'll have to release the latest colibri skin project  
mflorea - (09:57): but I'd wait for caty/sergiu to review my commit  
vmassol1 - (09:58): hmm not good  
vmassol1 - (09:58): we're already very late  
vmassol1 - (09:58): I cannot wait  
kwoot - (09:58): Not getting an answer means my question is too simple?  
vmassol1 - (09:58): or we'll delay by 3 days more  
kwoot - (09:59): except for the obvious explanation that you are all very busy :-)  
mflorea - (09:59): well, there was a discussion on the devs mailing list after my last commit and I changed ie-all.css according to Caty and Sergiu's remarks so it should be fine, just that I'd like them to review my commit  
vmassol1 - (09:59): mflorea: I didn't understand why you did cleanup  
vmassol1 - (10:00): in a final  
silviar joined #xwiki at 10:00  
mflorea - (10:00): it was not a clean up  
mflorea - (10:00): the CSS was invalid  
vmassol1 - (10:00): ok  
mflorea - (10:00): is worked  
mflorea - (10:00): s/is/it  
mflorea - (10:00): but you were not able to parse it with a CSS parser  
vmassol1 - (10:01): still risky imo  
vmassol1 - (10:01): if it worked....  
vmassol1 - (10:01): we're only fixing blocker bugs  
vmassol1 - (10:01): if it worked I woudn't consider it a blocker bug :)  
mflorea - (10:02): sure, but then my portlet integration won't work with 2.6 because of this. I don't think my commit was risky  
vmassol1 - (10:02): anyway done is done but for next time we should be more careful IMO  
vmassol1 - (10:02): portlet integration is not in the core  
mflorea - (10:02): I mean, won't work out of the box  
vmassol1 - (10:02): so it doesn't matter from the pov of XE  
mflorea - (10:02): sure, but you agree that I can make changes to XE to easy the integration  
vmassol1 - (10:03): no  
vmassol1 - (10:03): not in RCs  
vmassol1 - (10:03): or even less between RC and final  
vmassol1 - (10:03): too risky I think  
vmassol1 - (10:03): our goal is to make final a rename of the last RC btw  
rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 10:04  
tmortagne joined #xwiki at 10:11  
jstoldt - (10:11): could you check: XWIKI-5708  
jstoldt - (10:12): i think that one shouldn't be too hard to fix, prolly just a typo or anything  
jstoldt - (10:12): it'd be neat to have this fixed in 2.6 as well  
vmassol1 - (10:16): jstoldt: it'd be neat to have lots of things but we need to stop at some point  
vmassol1 - (10:16): it can be a candidate for 2.6.1  
jstoldt - (10:16): ;) true  
jstoldt - (10:16): okay :-D  
vmassol1 - (10:16): (and be released in 2 weeks from now)  
jstoldt - (10:16): cool  
qwebirc51292 - (10:16): +tmortagne, all i good with Java6. It was a miss class in java5 !  
qwebirc51292 - (10:17): thx a lotman  
vmassol1 - (10:20): it would be great if someone could look at fixing hudson while I prepare the release plan for 2.6  
vmassol1 - (10:20): seems it's sick: http://hudson.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-product-enterprise-tests-2.6/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/24/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui/AllTests/org\_xwiki\_test\_ui\_AllTests/  
vmassol1 - (10:20): must be some leftover processes  
tmortagne - (10:22): qwebirc51292: great (wondering if it's a bug or a general debian issue with java5)  
vmassol1 - (10:24): tmortagne: you think you could help me with the release by checking what's the pb with hudson?  
vmassol1 - (10:24): it would be good to verify the tests pass  
vmassol1 - (10:24): before starting  
tmortagne - (10:25): vmassol1: sure, give me just 5 minutes so that i finish to wakeup ;)  
vmassol1 - (10:25): :)

vmassol1 - (10:31): release plan ready: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/ReleasePlans#H2.6  
vmassol1 - (10:31): please let me know if I missed something  
vmassol1 - (10:31): mflorea: I haven't included annotation app nor webdav app since the changes are not required for 2.6 final I believe  
vmassol1 - (10:31): (I'm referring to: XAANNOTATIONS-38: Apply the module pattern to the JavaScript code  
vmassol1 - (10:32): and XAWEBDAV-8: Apply the module pattern to the JavaScript code)  
mflorea - (10:32): yes, they are not required for 2.6  
vmassol1 - (10:32): updating translations now  
vmassol1 - (10:33): sburjan`: have you tested the latest snapshot for 2.6?  
vmassol1 - (10:33): (good morning)  
evalica joined #xwiki at 10:34

vmassol1 - (10:49): tmortagne: I think it was caleb who added it  
vmassol1 - (10:49): as verification after rc2 was released  
vmassol1 - (10:49): but it's not really worth it IMO  
vmassol1 - (10:50): cjdelisle: ?

jstoldt - (11:08): mflorea: updated XWIKI-5703  
mflorea - (11:09): ok, thanks  
jstoldt - (11:09): you're welcome  
tmortagne - (11:10): mflorea: drag and drop is always fuzzy, sometime you select more or less depending where you stopped clicking on the mouse  
tmortagne - (11:10): s/drag and drop/drag/  
mflorea - (11:10): yes, that's the problem, IE selects the list item instead of selecting only the text  
tmortagne - (11:11): mflorea: maybe you can have noth on IE  
tmortagne - (11:11): both  
tmortagne - (11:11): depending if you are a pixel too far or not when you release the mouse  
tmortagne - (11:12): i usually have the same issue on Word  
mflorea - (11:12): I can't do that, text selection should be DOM oriented and not pixel based. IE's API is pixel based but the editor uses a generic API (IE's API is wrapped) to have a uniform implementation  
tmortagne - (11:14): mflorea: i don't suggest you to do anything i don't know how it's working. I'm just commenting on related issue i usually have with mouse selection.  
vmassol1 - (11:14): tmortagne: I have a pb with XEM translations resources  
vmassol1 - (11:15): the zip expands in a zip.cpgz file which expands in a zip file...  
mflorea - (11:15): tmortagne: I know, that's why I prefer selecting text with keyboard whenever possible  
tmortagne - (11:16): vmassol1: looking but i don't even know what is zip.cpgz file type  
vmassol1 - (11:16): me neither  
tmortagne - (11:16): which translation is it ?  
vmassol1 - (11:16): all except one  
vmassol1 - (11:16): for ex: XEM\_XEM.XEMtranslations.zip  
vmassol1 - (11:17): the reason is probably:  
vmassol1 - (11:17): vmassol@Desktop $ zip -Tv XEM\_XEM.XEMtranslations.zip  
vmassol1 - (11:17):         zip warning: missing end signature--probably not a zip file (did you  
vmassol1 - (11:17):         zip warning: remember to use binary mode when you transferred it?)  
vmassol1 - (11:17):         zip warning: (if you are trying to read a damaged archive try -F)  
vmassol1 - (11:17): zip error: Zip file structure invalid (XEM\_XEM.XEMtranslations.zip)  
vmassol1 - (11:17): vmassol@Desktop $  
tmortagne - (11:18): vmassol1: actualy looks like there is an error when it export the zip do you don't really get a zip but an error printed as a zip stream  
vmassol1 - (11:18): the pb is that I've tried to re-download it several times  
tmortagne - (11:18): at least that's what i get  
vmassol1 - (11:18): ok  
vmassol1 - (11:19): tmortagne: you're fixing it?  
jstoldt - (11:19): about ${escapetool.xml($propDef.getPrettyName())}, what does escapetool.xml do? just cleaning up a bit? and if so, what exactly is being cleaned?  
tmortagne - (11:19): vmassol1: but the error is very weird, looks like someone removed a method from the groovy class...  
tmortagne - (11:19): s/but/yes but/  
tmortagne - (11:20): are you able to export XE translations ?  
tmortagne - (11:20): actually there is no "Wiki Translations Page as XML" type in XE i think  
jstoldt - (11:20): about XE translations, i remember reporting a bug around the wysiwyg lists earlier this week and somebody - can't remember who - worked on it for a bit  
vmassol1 - (11:21): tmortagne: yes XE is fine  
tmortagne - (11:21): jstoldt: ok  
tmortagne - (11:21): jstoldt: escapetool.xml is escaping the string you are gicing to it so that it's not interpreted by a XML parser  
vmassol1 - (11:21): starting xwiki-core release  
tmortagne - (11:22): s/gicing/giving/  
jstoldt - (11:22): ah, i see!  
jstoldt - (11:22): thanks  
jstoldt - (11:22): so, if i use $msg.get i should still use it, right?  
tmortagne - (11:23): jstoldt: well it depends, we allow xhtml in translation messages  
tmortagne - (11:23): but if you are absolutely sure your translation is supposed to be litteral then yes  
jstoldt - (11:24): i am working on a patch to make the different labels in the class editor translatable, so i think going with literal is the way to go  
tmortagne - (11:24): indeed  
jstoldt - (11:24): although there should not be any XHTML in the translations but i'll go the safe way for now  
sabageru joined #xwiki at 11:25  
tmortagne - (11:25): sure always better  
tmortagne - (11:26): xml is not only about < and >, a translation could contains a & maybe  
jstoldt - (11:27): yeah  
abusenius joined #xwiki at 11:28  
jstoldt - (11:36): where can i find the definition of xWikiClass?  
vmassol1 - (11:36): guys please review http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise26 and improve it  
vmassol1 - (11:37): (I'll add the api breakage part later on)  
jstoldt - (11:37): ClassRessource.java?  
sburjan joined #xwiki at 11:41  
jstoldt - (11:41): let me rephrase my question, where can i find all the possible results $field.xWikiClass.get($classprop) could bring up?  
tmortagne - (11:42): $field.xWikiClass return a BaseClass or a Class (probably a Class in your case)  
tmortagne - (11:43): Class is the public version of BaseClass  
tmortagne - (11:43): I means com.xpn.xwiki.api.Class  
jstoldt - (11:43): any hint on the file that defines this?  
jstoldt - (11:44): lunch... see you in a bit  
tmortagne - (11:45): jstoldt: http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/core/trunk/xwiki-core/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/api/Class.java  
tmortagne - (11:46): vmassol1: fixed now  
tmortagne - (11:46): i means l10n export  
tmortagne - (11:46): s/means/mean/  
vmassol1 - (11:46): ok thanks  
flaviusolaru joined #xwiki at 11:50  
sburjan - (11:53): http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XE-754  
sburjan - (11:53): (reminder)  
sburjan - (11:53): if it's gonna be in 2.6 final  
vmassol1 - (11:53): sburjan: seems too late for me  
vmassol1 - (11:53): unless we consider it a blocer  
vmassol1 - (11:54): blocker  
sburjan - (11:54): I reported it 3 days ago  
sburjan - (11:54): it's not a blocker  
vmassol1 - (11:54): ok then for 2.6.1  
vmassol1 - (11:54): starting core 2.6 release  
jvelociter - (12:00): mflorea: about portlet integration and the JS ID function  
jvelociter - (12:01): do you plan on using it everywhery in XWiki where JS manipulates IDs ?  
mflorea - (12:01): jvelociter: only for ID literals  
jvelociter - (12:02): mflorea to be honest I'm not so convinced we should go that far. In my opinion the case where multiple XWiki portlets are displayed on the same page is marginal, and I'm not even sure we should support it  
lucaa - (12:03): guys, wdyt about  http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XE-756 ?  
mflorea - (12:04): jvelociter: it's not about multiple instance, it's about conflict with other portlets or the portal page itself. Take for instance the id of the wiki editor text area: 'content' it needs to be namespaced, so any JS that references it must be updated  
lucaa - (12:04): I'm especially interested in the macro name and parameters  
jvelociter - (12:04): mflorea: OK, then makes sense  
mflorea - (12:04): same with all IDs used by XWIki  
sburjan - (12:04): I think we will have to make the FoxWiki addon compatible with latest FF versions too .. in future  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 12:04  
jvelociter - (12:05): (we should not have too much IDs literals in JS anyway I think - if you have it's usually not a very good sign for the code ;) )  
mflorea - (12:05): yep, you should have it only in the main page, not in \*.js files  
mflorea - (12:05): maybe also in some specific js extensions  
jvelociter - (12:06): yes, but then maybe it would be best to refactor not to use IDs rather than use the ID funcituon  
mflorea - (12:08): I'm not sure you can leave without IDs at all. Reducing their number is good IMO, but my approach so far was to change as little as possible the platform  
jvelociter - (12:09): we need to decide on a case by case, yes. But the lesser the better  
mflorea - (12:09): yep, have to go now, be back in 1h  
mflorea left at 12:10 (Quit: Leaving.  
jstoldt - (12:17): i'm giving up  
jstoldt - (12:17): making the class editor localizable is a lot more work than i anticipated  
jstoldt - (12:18): sorry guys but i'll leave it to you then  
rrodriguez left at 12:19 (Quit: rrodriguez  
abusenius left at 12:20 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds  
tmortagne left at 12:22 (Quit: Leaving.  
tmortagne joined #xwiki at 12:22  
sdumitriu - (12:23): jstoldt: Need a hint?  
jstoldt - (12:24): well, it's not really about getting a hint. the problem is that you currently use GetPrettyName(), so basically any displayed class has a number of properties with "subproperties" attached  
jstoldt - (12:24): all of these have a prettyname which is hardcoded at this time  
jstoldt - (12:25): in order to make that localizable we'd either have to change the SetPrettyName calls for each and every of those classes to act multilanguage like  
jstoldt - (12:25): and i don't know if that would be possible if we want to change the language on the fly  
sdumitriu - (12:25): No  
sdumitriu - (12:25): It's much simpler than that  
sdumitriu - (12:26): Let me find a link  
jstoldt - (12:26): alternatively we'd have to rip out the entire stuff (because it'd get unused) and then just call the proper strings upon creation of the page  
jstoldt - (12:26): the latter part of that solution is rather quickly done if i had a list of strings to display  
sburjan - (12:26): sdumitriu: I was wondering about the attachments tab, and the Firefox extension to edit attachments. That will not work on IE browsers. Wouldn't be more elegant to show that button only if the uses uses FF ? Of example, like the eye icon appears when OO service is up and connected  
sburjan - (12:27): \*user  
jstoldt - (12:27): still, ripping out all the prettyNames would be a lot of hassle for me because i have little overview over the sources  
sdumitriu - (12:27): sburjan: It does work on IE  
sdumitriu - (12:27): But with a different mechanism  
jstoldt - (12:28): and no development environment that would have similar comfort to Visual Studio where i'd just load the project and make a search for all the pretty name stuff  
tmortagne left at 12:28 (Quit: Leaving.  
sburjan - (12:28): sdumitriu: then we have a minor bug on IE6  
sburjan - (12:29): I will report it.  
jstoldt - (12:29): summing it up, either i get a list and i present you with a quick patch for editclass.vm without ripping out all the pretty name stuff... or i'm giving up on it for now  
tmortagne joined #xwiki at 12:29  
sdumitriu - (12:31): jstoldt: Look at https://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/core/trunk/xwiki-core/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/objects/classes/ListClass.java , getDisplayValue(String value, String name, Map<String, ListItem> map, XWikiContext context)  
tmortagne left at 12:32 (Client Quit  
sdumitriu - (12:33): Or in https://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/core/trunk/xwiki-core/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/objects/classes/PropertyClass.java getTranslatedPrettyName  
tmortagne joined #xwiki at 12:33  
flaviusolaru left at 12:34 (Quit: Leaving.  
jstoldt - (12:37): seriously, this is beyond me right now. i just lack enough understanding of the whole api and structure...

vmassol1 - (13:47): seems like XEM translations have never been applied before....  
vmassol1 - (13:54): tmortagne: is it ok to commit new translations in XEM even if they're empty?  
vmassol1 - (13:55): hmmm probably not  
vmassol1 - (13:55): but then it means we need to check manually every time  
vmassol1 - (13:55): for ex I get: http://tinypaste.com/f2f1e0  
vmassol1 - (13:56): if I commit this then the user won't see anything on the page  
vmassol1 - (13:56): IMO l10n shouldn't generate these files when they're empty  
vmassol1 - (13:56): wdyt?  
Enygma` joined #xwiki at 13:56  
tmortagne - (13:57): vmassol1: pretty sure sdumitriu applied then in 2.5 branch  
tmortagne - (13:57): ha di dnot seen the "empty" part  
vmassol1 - (13:57): they're not in trunk for sure  
tmortagne - (13:58): l10n do filter empty translations actually maybe there is a bug for translations wiki pages  
vmassol1 - (13:58): ah btw
